column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#Text=The first Buds of Ribes Nigra infused in Wines,
#Text=especially Rhenish, makes it diuretick, and more
#Text=fragrant in Smell and Taste, and so doth Clary.
#Text=The Inconvenience is, that the Wine becomes more
#Text=heady, for which Elder Flowers added to the Clary
#Text=is a Remedy, which also betters the Fragancy
#Text=thereof, as ’tis manifest in Elder-Vinegar; but these
#Text=Flowers are apt to make the Wine ropy.
#Text=To help brown Malaga and Spanish Wines, take
#Text=Powder of Orras-Roots, and Salt-Petre, of each
#Text=four Ounces, the Whites of eight Eggs, whereto
#Text=add as much Salt as will make a Brine, put this
#Text=Mixture into the Wine, and mix them with a Staff.
#Text=To meliorate muddy and tawny Clarets.
#Text=Take of
#Text=Rain-water two Pints, the Yelks of eight Eggs,
#Text=Salt an Handful, beat them well, let them stand
#Text=six Hours before you put them into the Cask,
#Text=then use the Rod, and in three Days it will come
#Text=to itself.
#Text=To amend the Taste and Smell of Malaga .
#Text=Take of the best Almonds four Pounds, make
#Text=therewith, and with sufficient Quantity of the
#Text=Wine to be cured, an Emulsion, then take the
#Text=Whites and Yelks of twelve Eggs,
#Text=beat them together with a Handful of Salt,
#Text=put them into the
#Text=Pipe, using the Rod.
#Text=To amend the Smell and Taste of French and
#Text=Rhenish which are foul.
#Text=Take to an Auln of the
#Text=Wine, of Honey one Pound, of Elder-Flowers a
#Text=Handful, Orras Powder an Ounce, one Nutmeg,
#Text=a few Cloves, boil them in a sufficient Quantity of
#Text=the Wine to be cured, to the Consumption of half;
#Text=when ’tis cold, strain and use it with the Rod;
#Text=some add a little Salt.
#Text=If the Wine be sweet enough,
#Text=add of Spirits of Wine one Pound to a Hogshead,
#Text=and give the Cask a strong Scent.
#Text=Spirit of Wine
#Text=makes any Wine brisk, and fines it without the
#Text=former Mixture.
